intro: Stauntonia obovata var. angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stauntonia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
